neighborhoods.name: Innere Stadt
neighborhoods.character: The historic heart of Graz, a UNESCO World Heritage site, filled with stunning architecture, narrow streets, grand squares, and major landmarks.

location.description: Core of the city, located primarily on the left bank of the Mur river, centered around Hauptplatz and Herrengasse.
landmarks: Burg mit Doppelwendeltreppe (Castle with Double Spiral Staircase)

history.overview: The medieval and Renaissance core of Graz, residence of the Habsburgs in the 15th century, expanded over centuries.
history.significance: Political, cultural, and economic center of Styria for centuries. UNESCO site due to well-preserved historical fabric.

transit: Excellent tram and bus access (Hauptplatz, Jakominiplatz hub nearby)
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Year-round; Summer for outdoor cafes and events, December for Christmas markets.

attractions.name: Schlossberg & Uhrturm
attractions.description: Forested hill overlooking the city with the iconic Clock Tower.
attractions.appeal: Panoramic views, symbol of Graz, relaxing park.

attractions.name: Landeszeughaus (Styrian Armoury)
attractions.description: World's largest historic armoury with 32,000 items.

attractions.name: Grazer Dom & Mausoleum
attractions.description: Impressive Gothic cathedral and adjacent Mannerist mausoleum.

activities.name: Stroll down Herrengasse
activities.description: Explore Graz's main shopping street with beautiful facades.

activities.name: Explore Hidden Courtyards
activities.description: Discover charming courtyards accessible from main streets.

activities.name: Ride the Schlossbergbahn or Lift
activities.description: Easily reach the top of the Schlossberg for views.

stay_here_if: You want to be in the absolute center, surrounded by history, landmarks, shopping, and dining.
avoid_if: You prefer modern architecture, quiet residential streets, or are on a very tight budget (accommodation can be pricier).
insider_tips: Take advantage of the free 'Altstadtbim' tram for short hops.
Look for the 'Gothic Picture Scroll' fresco on the outside of the Dom.
Don't hesitate to peek into open doorways – many lead to stunning courtyards.
Visit the farmers markets on Kaiser-Josef-Platz or Lendplatz (borders Innere Stadt/Lend).

neighborhoods.name: Lend
neighborhoods.character: Trendy, multicultural, and creative district on the right bank of the Mur, known for its design scene, markets, and alternative vibe.

location.description: West of Innere Stadt, across the Mur river.

history.overview: Historically a working-class and industrial area, significantly revitalized, especially since Graz was European Capital of Culture 2003.
history.significance: Center of Graz's modern design and creative scene, known for its multiculturalism.
notable_events: Emergence as a trendy, artistic neighborhood

transit: Good tram and bus connections (e.g., Südtiroler Platz/Kunsthaus)
practical_info.safety: Generally safe, vibrant area day and night.
practical_info.walkability: Excellent, easy to walk to Innere Stadt.

attractions.name: Kunsthaus Graz
attractions.description: Modern art museum with unique 'blob' architecture.
attractions.appeal: Iconic modern landmark, contemporary art exhibitions.

attractions.name: Murinsel
attractions.description: Steel island connecting the river banks, housing a cafe.
attractions.appeal: Unique structure, nice spot for coffee.

attractions.name: Farmers Market at Lendplatz
attractions.description: Popular daily farmers market with fresh produce and food stalls.

activities.name: Browse Design Shops
activities.description: Explore independent boutiques around Lendplatz and Mariahilferstraße.

activities.name: Relax at a Café
activities.description: Enjoy the atmosphere at one of Lend's many trendy cafes.

stay_here_if: You love modern design, a creative atmosphere, markets, and want to be close to the center but with a different vibe.
avoid_if: You prefer traditional historic settings or very quiet, purely residential areas.
insider_tips: Visit the Lendplatz market in the morning for the best selection and atmosphere.
Cross the river via the Murinsel for a unique experience.
Explore the streets radiating from Lendplatz for interesting shops and cafes.
Check the Kunsthaus exhibition schedule in advance.

neighborhoods.name: Jakomini
neighborhoods.character: Central, bustling district south of the Old Town, serving as a major transport hub and offering a mix of residential, commercial, and administrative functions.

location.description: Immediately south of Innere Stadt, centered around Jakominiplatz.

history.overview: Developed significantly in the 19th century with the expansion of the city and transportation networks.
history.significance: Became the central node for public transport in Graz.
notable_events: Establishment of Jakominiplatz as the central tram hub

transit: The absolute hub for almost all tram and many bus lines in Graz (Jakominiplatz).
practical_info.safety: Generally safe, but Jakominiplatz can be very crowded and busy.
practical_info.walkability: Good, easy walk to Innere Stadt and Stadtpark.

known_for: Proximity to city center and Stadtpark

attractions.name: Jakominiplatz
attractions.description: The central point for public transport in Graz.

attractions.name: Messe Congress Graz
attractions.appeal: Hosts various trade fairs and events.

activities.name: Catch a Tram/Bus
activities.description: Easily access any part of the city from Jakominiplatz.

activities.name: Walk to Stadtpark
activities.description: Enjoy the large city park bordering the district.

stay_here_if: You prioritize excellent public transport connections or are attending an event at the Messe.
You are looking for potentially more budget-friendly accommodation near the center.
avoid_if: You want a charming, historic atmosphere or a very quiet neighborhood. Jakominiplatz itself is purely functional.
insider_tips: Jakominiplatz is purely a transit hub, the surrounding streets offer more character.
Use Jakominiplatz as your starting point to explore anywhere in Graz via public transport.
Walk east towards the Stadtpark for greenery.

neighborhoods.name: Geidorf
neighborhoods.character: Leafy, predominantly residential district north of the Old Town, home to the University of Graz (Karl-Franzens-Universität) and characterized by elegant buildings and a student presence.

history.overview: Developed significantly with the expansion of the University in the 19th and 20th centuries.
history.significance: Center of academic life in Graz.
notable_events: Establishment and expansion of the University of Graz campus

transit: Good bus connections, some tram lines nearby.
practical_info.safety: Very safe, pleasant residential and academic area.

best_for: Those seeking a quiet but central residential area

attractions.name: University of Graz Campus
attractions.description: Explore the historic main campus buildings.

attractions.name: Leechkirche
attractions.description: One of the oldest churches in Graz, noted for its Gothic architecture.

attractions.name: Hilmteich
attractions.description: Popular recreational area with a pond, walking paths, and cafes.

activities.name: Walk around the University
activities.description: Admire the university buildings and atmosphere.

activities.name: Relax by the Hilmteich
activities.description: Enjoy a walk or coffee by the pond.

stay_here_if: You are visiting the university, appreciate leafy residential areas, or want a quieter base near the city center.
avoid_if: You are looking for vibrant nightlife or extensive shopping within immediate walking distance.
insider_tips: The University Library (UB) often has interesting exhibitions.
Explore the streets around the university for charming architecture.
Hilmteich is lovely for a relaxing afternoon.

neighborhoods.name: Eggenberg
neighborhoods.character: Primarily residential district in the west of Graz, dominated by the magnificent Eggenberg Palace and its surrounding park.

history.overview: Historically a separate village, its identity is strongly linked to the Eggenberg family and their palace, built in the 17th century.
history.significance: Home to Eggenberg Palace, a UNESCO World Heritage site and major cultural attraction.
notable_events: Palace and Park designated UNESCO World Heritage site (as extension of Graz Old Town)

transit: Tram line 1 provides direct access from the city center.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Spring/Summer/Autumn to enjoy the palace gardens; check palace opening times.
practical_info.walkability: Good within the neighborhood, especially around the palace park.

best_for: Those seeking a major attraction outside the immediate center

attractions.name: Schloss Eggenberg
attractions.description: Magnificent Baroque palace with state rooms, gardens, and museums.
attractions.appeal: Major cultural highlight of Graz, stunning architecture and art.

attractions.name: Palace Gardens
attractions.description: Extensive historical gardens surrounding the palace, home to peacocks.

activities.name: Tour Eggenberg Palace State Rooms
activities.description: Guided tours showcasing the palace's stunning interiors.

activities.name: Wander the Palace Gardens
activities.description: Explore the extensive park, enjoy nature, spot peacocks.

activities.name: Visit the Palace Museums
activities.description: Explore the Old Masters gallery or the archaeology collection.

stay_here_if: You plan to spend significant time at Eggenberg Palace or prefer a quiet, residential area away from the downtown bustle.
avoid_if: You want easy, immediate walking access to the Innere Stadt's attractions, dining, and nightlife.
insider_tips: Check the specific opening times for the palace state rooms and museums, as they can vary seasonally.
Allow ample time to explore both the palace and the extensive gardens.
Tram line 1 is the easiest way to reach Eggenberg from the city center.
